top_categories.workout_context: 150 miles. Your legs will beg to quit after 120. This trains the power output you need from mile 130 onward.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Gravel Worlds' demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before August.
Gravel Worlds' Nebraska farm gravel, Minimum maintenance roads forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 150 miles.
Every hard session works better with a bigger aerobic base. At 150 miles, base fitness is the difference between racing and surviving.
67ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
10,000ft of climbing means repeated surges above threshold. VO2max work is how you survive the fifth climb, not just the first.
150 miles rewards fat oxidation. This volume work shifts your fuel mix so you're still burning fat at hour 5, not bonking at hour 3.
At Gravel Worlds, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Gravel Worlds. Train it until it feels boring.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Gravel Worlds, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
Short, max efforts are unavoidable. Punchy climbs, gap closures, attacks on classic Nebraska farm gravel with minimum. If you haven't trained them, you'll crack.
Endurance with intensity spikes baked in. Exactly what 10,000ft of climbing on classic Nebraska farm gravel with minimum does to your power file on race day.

race_overlay.heat: August in Lincoln, Nebraska (Sandhills Global Event Center) — August brings humidity, heat, and the kind of Midwest summer that tests your heat tolerance. Begin heat acclimatization 10–14 days before Gravel Worlds — 20–30min sauna sessions or midday rides in full kit. Pre-load sodium 48 hours out. Target 500–750ml/hr with electrolytes on race day. Race-day realities: Heat index can exceed 100°F; Humidity is brutal.
race_overlay.nutrition: Ultra-distance fueling for 150 miles: 80–100g carbs/hour from mile 1 — don’t wait until you’re hungry. Practice your exact race-day nutrition in every long training ride. Carry backup calories. 150 miles burns 8,000–12,000+ calories — you cannot replace them all, but you must try.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Gravel Worlds requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on classic nebraska farm gravel with minimum maintenance roads to build confidence. Expect: nebraska farm gravel, minimum maintenance roads, rolling terrain.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Durability, Race Simulation, and Gravel Specific to prepare you for 150 miles of classic nebraska farm gravel with minimum maintenance roads in Lincoln, Nebraska (Sandhills Global Event Center).
